author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
Like the mead, it hast in richness grown,
Oil, our era's bounty, marks a throne.
Brent's tides high as Skadi's frozen home,
A deficit looms, scarce as Einherjar's comb.

As the dollar, on slippery ice it glides,
In greenback's decline, the market confides.
Fed eyes not the surge, but the lowering tides,
At core inflation's fall, the trader abides.

'Tis a medley of matters, the metals' fate,
Gold's luster dims, as the wolves lie in wait.
Fate hangs on ECB's pendulous rate,
A decision that could the markets' course dictate.

feedItems.title: Oil Hits Fresh High on Supply Deficit Forecasts
feedItems.description: Oil prices rose, with Brent setting a fresh 10-month high as investors anticipated a supply shortfall throughout the rest of the year.

feedItems.title: Dollar Slips as Market Assumes Fed Will Focus on Falling Core Inflation
feedItems.description: U.S. inflation data, which showed headline annual CPI rose slightly more than expected to 3.7%, had only a limited impact on the dollar, which now trades slightly lower, MUFG said, as investors anticipate the Fed to place focus on a slowing trend for the core inflation.

feedItems.title: Metals Mixed Ahead of ECB Rate Decision
feedItems.description: Base metals prices were mixed, while gold edged lower, with Peak Trading saying “the euro comprises 58% of the U.S. dollar index, so today’s ECB policy decision and the currency impact on our commodity markets could be significant.”

author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
In Thyssenkrupp's courtyard, a change they raise,
Merging spheres to quell the smoky haze.
With key technologies they unite,
In pursuit of targets, financial and bright.

Fair Éire's treasury prepares the bond,
With a billion in offering, of fortunes fond.
Danske Bank bids be long in stance,
On solid ground, they see the chance.

The sun in the East brings wealth anew,
Rising Nikkei, to first light true.
Real estate, auto, and sparks of light,
Ease Fed’s reign and lift the night.

feedItems.title: Thyssenkrupp to Reorganize Portfolio, Boost Performance
feedItems.description: Thyssenkrupp said it would merge some businesses into a new unit combining key decarbonization technologies, while also launching a group-wide performance program to help achieve its financial targets.

feedItems.title: Ireland to Conduct Last Government Bond Auction in 2023
feedItems.description: Ireland’s National Treasury Management Agency is heading into its last government bond auction of the year, offering €1 billion in 2027- and 2045-dated bonds and Danske Bank Research recommends being long in Irish government bonds versus EU peers on solid fundamentals.

feedItems.title: Nikkei Rises 1.4%, Led by Real-Estate, Auto Stocks
feedItems.description: Japanese stocks ended higher, led by gains in real estate, auto and electronics shares, as concerns eased about the Fed’s further tightening.

author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
Canal of Panama, in drought's harsh clasp,
Where boats and trade in thirsty rasp.
Goats of global chains now gasp,
In water's dearth, they grasp and grasp.

India's web, like snails recoiled,
By own hand, the prosper foiled.
Rabbits of the digital field,
In dark burrows, their fate sealed.

In grand bazaar of arms and steel,
Found China, Russia, 'neath the seal.
The dog of war, betrayed his feel,
And Saudi dreams did shatter, reel.

feedItems.title: How the Panama Canal's Drought Is Threatening Global Supply Chains
feedItems.description: The Panama Canal is running out of water, threatening the global supply chains and industries that depend on it. WSJ takes you inside the canal’s operations to understand what this means for the future of this vital shipping route.

feedItems.title: India Keeps Pulling the Plug on Its Digital Economy
feedItems.description: India’s government leads the world in internet shutdowns, cutting off access more than all other nations combined.

feedItems.title: Arms Megadeal Collapsed When China, Russia Links Emerged
feedItems.description: Failed talks between RTX and a Saudi defense firm show the kingdom’s difficulties in establishing its own military industry.

author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
Upon the land of Ukraine, this tale I must retell,
West courted Russia’s brethren but alas, it dost not gel.
They speak of victories grand, their cloaks in hubris immersed,
Yet sides remain unchosen in this war, by gold unrehearsed.

In view of ale-soaked cellars, a tale of prices sprung, 
The cost of fuel hath soared, on every common tongue. 
OPEC and her kin have turned the spigot thin,
'Tis but a ghostly echo, the once-full barrel’s tin.

Now hark! Las Vegas, city of sin and neon light,
Hit by a cyber arrow, in day turned into night.
A step into the past, a time of cog and gear,
For MGM's proud towers, an echo drawing near.

feedItems.title: West Fails to Woo Russia's Friends to Ukraine's Side
feedItems.description: Many emerging economies remain reluctant to take sides in the war, though Western diplomats say they have chalked up some significant successes.

feedItems.title: Fuel Prices Are Soaring: Who Is Feeling the Pinch?
feedItems.description: Production cuts made by OPEC and its allies have pushed crude oil to 10-month highs.

feedItems.title: The Cyberattack That Sent Las Vegas Back in Time
feedItems.description: The security issue left MGM Resorts hotels on the Strip with an oddly analog vibe.
